intro: Cussonia paniculata, commonly known as the African arrowroot or elephant's foot, is a striking tropical plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizome and large, waxy, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
